intro: Hieracium centrophyllum, commonly known as the central-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with a stem that bears several flowering heads. The flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
